Title:
Tricholoma olivaceonigrum, a new species of the section
Tricholoma (Agaricales) from Japan
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Tricholoma, Evergreen oak, Molecular
phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
A novel species of the genus Tricholoma and section
Tricholoma, namely, T. olivaceonigrum, is described and illustrated
based on samples found in an oak woods dominated by the evergreen oak
species Quercus myrsinifolia in Tottori Prefecture, western Japan. It is
characterized by a conic-umbonate, dark-greenish olivaceous pileus with
innate blackish fibrils; a whitish silky-fibrillose stipe, often faintly
tinted pale yellow and with a narrowed subpointed base; subglobose to
broadly elliptic spores; habitat in an oak woods dominated by the
evergreen Q. myrsinifolia; and fruiting in early winter. Phylogenetic
analysis targeting the internal transcribed spacer region of the
ribosomal RNA gene revealed that T. olivaceonigrum forms a
well-supported sister clade to T. portentosum. Other morphologically and
phylogenetically closely related species of the section Tricholoma are
discussed.
